title: The Mysterious Murder at Maple Mansion
story: Maple Mansion, a grand and luxurious estate located on the outskirts of town, was the scene of a shocking crime. Last night, the wealthy owner of the mansion, Mr. Edward Maple, was found dead in his study, with no apparent cause of death.

The investigating officers have yet to determine whether it was a suicide, an accident, or foul play. To crack this case wide open, Detective Laura Patterson has been assigned to this high-profile investigation.

As Detective Patterson arrives at Maple Mansion, she is greeted by a myriad of suspicious characters and an abundance of clues. It is now her responsibility to separate lies from truth, and uncover what really happened on that fateful night.

suspect.name: Victoria Maple
suspect.alibi: Victoria Maple, the wife of the deceased, claims to have been at a charity event across town during the estimated time of the crime.
suspect.confirmation: Detective Patterson must verify the alibi and ascertain whether Victoria is telling the truth.

witness.name: Robert Johnson
witness.observation: Robert Johnson, the mansion's gardener, states that he saw a masked man running away from the study on the night of the murder.
witness.description: Detective Patterson needs to interview Robert further to gather more details about the masked man and determine his reliability as a witness.

npcs.name: Rebecca Clarke
npcs.dialogue: Rebecca Clarke, the wealthy heiress and neighbor, was heard arguing with Mr. Maple the day before the crime. However, she insists it was just a minor disagreement.
npcs.mood: Detective Patterson must probe further into Rebecca's relationship with the victim and verify her claim of a mere spat.

npcs.name: Andrew Thompson
npcs.dialogue: Andrew Thompson, the mansion's butler, states he was in the basement at the time of the murder, and did not hear or see anything unusual.
npcs.mood: Detective Patterson needs to confirm Andrew's alibi and uncover any potential signs of involvement.

clues.Front Door: The front door shows signs of forced entry, suggesting that someone may have entered or exited the mansion without permission.
clues.Library Door: The library door is slightly ajar, indicating that someone may have recently entered or exited the room.
clues.Kitchen Door: Fresh footprints near the kitchen door suggest recent activity in that area of the mansion.
clues.Lobby: A broken vase lies on the floor, potentially indicating a struggle or disturbance.
